Package queue

Interface Queue

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    QueueObject, QueueWrapper, QueueWrapperLimit, QueueWrapperLock, QueueWrapperSem, QueueWrapperSync
    public interface Queue
    This interface abstracts the methods associated with a queue. Its type is int, but with a little more work on it, we can make it generic (aka Template in C++).

    A queue is an array-style abstract data type, with the possibility of scrolling the content forward or reverse, and with one or more iterators.

    Author:
    Cristiano Salerno

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getCount()
      Return the elements' count of the queue.
      int getSize()
      Return the size (not the elements' count) of the queue.
      void insert​(int elem)
      Insert an element of type int inside the queue, following a rule choosen by a wrapper.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Determine if there are no elements in the queue.
      boolean isFull()
      Determine if there are as many elements as the queue's size.
      int retrieve()
      Retrieve an element of type int from the queue, following a rule choosen by a wrapper.

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Determine if there are no elements in the queue.
        Returns:
        A boolean, indicating if there are no elements in the queue (true), or there is at least one element (false).

      • isFull

        boolean isFull()
        Determine if there are as many elements as the queue's size.
        Returns:
        A boolean, indicating if there are as many elements as the queue size (true), or it there is at least one free spot (false).

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Return the size (not the elements' count) of the queue.
        Returns:
        An int, indicating how many elements the queue can contain.

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        Return the elements' count of the queue.
        Returns:
        An int, indicating how many elements are in the queue.

      • insert

        void insert​(int elem)
        Insert an element of type int inside the queue, following a rule choosen by a wrapper.
        Parameters:
        elem - The element to insert into the queue, following the policy of the object that implements the interface.

      • retrieve

        int retrieve()
        Retrieve an element of type int from the queue, following a rule choosen by a wrapper.
        Returns:
        The object to retrieve from the queue, following the policy of the object that implements the interface.
